# Simpler Recipes

> A clean, ad-free recipe extraction and browsing service.

## What This Site Does

Simpler Recipes extracts recipes from cluttered food blogs and presents them in a clean, readable format. Users can paste any recipe URL to get just the essential information: ingredients, instructions, prep time, cook time, and servings.

## Individual Recipe URLs

Each recipe has a permanent URL:
- Pattern: https://simpler.recipes/recipes/{recipe-slug}
- Example: https://simpler.recipes/recipes/best-chocolate-chip-cookies
- Example: https://simpler.recipes/recipes/worlds-best-lasagna
- Example: https://simpler.recipes/recipes/pad-thai

## API Endpoints

### List All Collections
GET https://simpler.recipes/api/recipes
Returns metadata and recipe lists for all collections.

### Get Collection Details
GET https://simpler.recipes/api/recipes/collection/{collection-slug}
Returns full recipe data for a specific collection.

Example: https://simpler.recipes/api/recipes/collection/baking-basics

### Get Individual Recipe
GET https://simpler.recipes/api/recipes/{recipe-slug}
Returns complete recipe data including ingredients, instructions, times, and source.

Example: https://simpler.recipes/api/recipes/best-chocolate-chip-cookies

## Recipe Data Structure

Each recipe includes:
- title: Recipe name
- ingredients: Array of ingredient strings with quantities
- instructions: Array of step-by-step instructions
- prepTime: Preparation time (e.g., "20 min")
- cookTime: Cooking time (e.g., "10 min")
- totalTime: Total time required
- servings: Number of servings
- source: Original source with name and URL
- tags: Categorization tags (e.g., "vegetarian", "pasta", "quick")

## Usage Notes

- All recipes are sourced from popular cooking websites with proper attribution
- Recipe data is refreshed periodically
- The site works best with AllRecipes, Food Network, Serious Eats, and most sites using Schema.org recipe markup
- No account required, no tracking beyond basic analytics
